titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Reverend Cecil Corbett is a Nez Perce Native American, retired pastor, and former president and chancellor at Cook College and Theological School in Tempe, Arizona. He was also a founding member of the Native American Theological Education Consortium, which later became the Native American Consulting Committee (NACC). The NACC is comprised of sixteen Native Americans who represent the synods of Alaska Northwest, Lakes and Prairies, Northeast, Pacific, Rocky Mountains, Southern California and Hawaii, Southwest and Sun. The committee provides representation for Native American members, churches and communities within the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.).

scopecontent.p: This collection is of Cecil Corbett's administrative papers and records relating to his work with the Native American Consulting Committee (NACC), which include NACC minutes, reports, position papers, and proposals; printed copies of the Indian Quest newsletter and records related to its publication; financial records; correspondence and memoranda; subject files, including on topics such as education, scholarships and legal issues; NACC membership lists; and Native American Ministry policy statements of the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.).

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: National Ministries Division, Racial/Ethic Ministries
